meanings.sent1: She always manages to outwrite her classmates in every essay competition.
meanings.sent2: I hope to outwrite my favorite author one day.
meanings.sent3: The young writer outwrites the old master, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her words outwrite the silence that once filled the room.
meanings.sent5: With determination and practice, anyone can outwrite their previous works.

meanings.definition: The act of writing better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: His outwriting of the other students' essays was evident in the teacher's praise.
meanings.sent2: The outwriting in her novel set a new standard for the genre.
meanings.sent3: The outwriting in the poetry contest was fierce but friendly.
meanings.sent4: Her outwriting shone like a beacon in the sea of mediocrity.
meanings.sent5: The outwriting in his journal entries was a source of inspiration for many.
